Description: Fragment of body, mended from three sherds, of Chian pottery dinos or krater. Highly micaceous clay; worn cream slip on exterior. Inside reserved; outside: at top probably part of lion's paw, to left. below, grazing goats to right, one nearly fully preserved, two others by their legs only; fill includes a tall horseshoe rosette on the floor; below, parts of three stags to right, with large antlers and dotted bodies. Traces of glue on top edge of upper sherd.
Curator's comments: From same vase as Cambridge, Fitzwilliam Museum GR 232.1894.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.952)
